text: Here's the job description: Company Description  At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.  We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.  Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.  Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.  We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.  You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.  We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.  We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.  When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.  Job Description  AECOM is seeking a Senior Architect to join our Sports Team and to primarily work on sports related projects.  The Senior Architect will be responsible for the following items:  Responsible for providing architectural guidance, calculations, analysis, studies and recommendations for a specialized segment of the Architectural Discipline within the schedules and budget of an assigned project. May manage various size groups of architects, designers and/or specialists  May work on modest size projects and/or assist Project Architectural or Engineering Managers with higher grades  Managing and overseeing multiple projects at various stages of development from the Schematic Design/Conception phase through to Design Development, Construction Drawings, Bidding/Contract Negotiation, Construction Administration and Closeout phases making sure that project teams meet quality, schedule, contractual, and budget goals  Develop solutions to complex technical problems in the execution of sports related project and other public and private sector projects  Manage relationships and communications with clients, vendors and contractors including design and construction project meetings  Lead in the management and preparation of proposals for architectural projects including the development of work effort estimates  Lead planning documents and project definition for project delivery  Ensure project designs meets all local building codes and federal guidelines  Establish & maintain project design schedule and timeline milestones  Develop, review & monitor project design budgets and schedules  Assist with and review estimates for assigned projects  Maintain project records and files, including correspondence, drawings, and other design documents  Review construction documents for compliance with client/project requirements  Verify the accuracy and completeness of all drawings and specifications as part of an organized QA/QC process  Provide Leadership and mentorship of staff and internal project team  AECOM’s Buildings + Places practice includes architecture, interiors, building engineering, workplace strategy, business transformation, asset advisory, economics and development planning, master planning, urban planning, and landscape architecture. With a range of expertise from strategy and design through project realization, we create better outcomes to grow economies, protect natural systems, conserve natural resources, make societies more equitable, and connect and engage people through innovative, sustainable design solutions. Our teams have worked on signature projects such as the London 2012 Olympic Park and Legacy Framework, to the new plan for the LA2028 Olympics, to industrial facilities for GE and Rolls-Royce, to headquarters and workplaces for NASA, Unilever, Sony Music, DirecTV, Box, Inc., and many Fortune 500 companies.  Qualifications  Minimum Requirements :  BA/BS in Architecture plus six (6) years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education  Architecture License  Preferred Qualifications :  Master’s degree in Architecture  Proficient in B.I.M, Revit, Adobe Creative Suite, Auto CAD  5 years of experience working on sports related projects of different scopes and sizes is highly preferred  Additional Information  Relocation is not available for this position  Sponsorship is not available for this position  This position is open to a remote working situation  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.  AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.  Join us and let’s get started.

text: "Write a reflection on the process of writing the essay below, following the specific instructions given after the essay. Essay you wrote:  Typography and Identity  John Eligon's New York Times article, “A Debate Over Identity and Race Asks, Are African-Americans ‘Black’ or ‘black’?” outlines the ongoing conversation among journalists and academics regarding conventions for writing about race—specifically, whether or not to capitalize the “b” in “black” when referring to African-Americans (itself a term that is going out of style). Eligon argues that, while it might seem like a minor typographical issue, this small difference speaks to the question of how we think about race in the United States. Are words like “black” or “white” mere adjectives, descriptors of skin color? Or are they proper nouns, indicative of group or ethnic identity? Eligon observes that until recently, with the prominence of the Black Lives Matter movement, many journalistic and scholarly publications tended to use a lowercase “black,” while Black media outlets  typically capitalized “Black.”  He suggests that the balance is now tipping in favor of ""Black,"" but given past changes, usage will probably change again as the rich discussion about naming, identity, and power continues.  Eligon points to a range of evidence that ""Black"" is becoming the norm, including a recent change by ""hundreds of news organizations"" including the Associated Press. This comes in the wake of the George Floyd killing, but it also follows a longtime Black press tradition exemplified by newspapers like The New York Amsterdam News. Eligon cites several prominent academics who are also starting to capitalize Black.  However, he also quotes prominent naysayers and describes a variety of counterarguments, like the idea that capitalization gives too much dignity to a category that was made up to oppress people.  Capitalizing Black raises another tricky question: Shouldn't White be likewise capitalized? Eligon points out that the groups most enthusiastic to capitalize White seem to be white supremacists, and news organizations want to avoid this association.    Eligon's brief history of the debate over racial labels, from “Negro” and “colored” to “African-American” and “person of color,” gives the question of to-capitalize-or-not-to-capitalize a broader context, investing what might seem like a minor quibble for editors with the greater weight of racial identity and its evolution over time. He outlines similar disagreements over word-choice and racial labels by scholars and activists like Fannie Barrier Williams and W.E.B. Du Bois surrounding now-antiquated terms like “Negro” and “colored.” These leaders debated whether labels with negative connotations should be replaced, or embraced and given a new, positive connotation. Eligon observes that today's ""black"" was once used as a pejorative but was promoted by the Black Power movement starting in the late sixties, much as the word ""Negro"" was reclaimed as a positive word. However, the Reverend Jesse Jackson also had some success in calling for a more neutral term, ""African American,"" in the late eighties.  He thought it more appropriate to emphasize a shared ethnic heritage over color.   Eligon suggests that this argument continues to appeal to some today, but that such terms have been found to be inadequate given the diversity of ethnic heritage. “African-American” and the more generalized “people/person of color” do not give accurate or specific enough information.   Ultimately, Eligon points to personal intuition as an aid to individuals in the Black community grappling with these questions. He describes the experience of sociologist Crystal M. Fleming, whose use of lowercase “black” transformed to capitalized “Black” over the course of her career and years of research. Her transition from black to Black is, she says, as much a matter of personal choice as a reasoned conclusion—suggesting that it will be up to Black journalists and academics to determine the conventions of the future.  Eligon's statistical and anecdotal survey of current usage of Black and black covers enough ground to convince us of the trend in favor of capitalization. But the value of Eligon's article lies in the attention it brings both to the convention and the discussion as a way for the Black community to wrestle with history and define itself.  By presenting a variety of past and present opinions from Black leaders, Eligon gives a sense of the richness and relevance of this ongoing debate.  His focus at the end on the opinion of one Black scholar, Crystal Fleming, offers an appealing intuitive approach to these decisions about naming. This idea is more hinted at than developed, leaving us to wonder how many other leaders share Fleming's approach and whether this approach might lead to chaos, as each writer might choose a different way to refer to racial identity. Still, Eligon's ending leaves us hopeful about the positive outcome of continuing the discussion: perhaps decisions about naming can help the Black community find self-definition in the face of historical injustice.    Reflection Assignment: Choose from the options below and write at least two paragraphs of reflection on either the process, product, or big picture of your learning as you wrote this essay. PROCESS Options What aspect of this work proved most challenging? What specific strategies did you utilize to work through and overcome the challenge? What part of the work was most enjoyable to you? What specific tasks or steps were enjoyable and what might that tell you about your own learning skills and preferences? PRODUCT Options What do you feel is the strongest component of your submitted work? What connection can you make between your effort and the strength(s) you identified? Given additional time, what would you enhance in your work? Describe the aspects that you would want to improve or add to and the steps you would follow to achieve those enhancement goals? BIG PICTURE Options How did this new learning impact your growth as student and/or person? What challenged a belief, opinion, or perspective? How are your choosing to process and work through that challenge? What strategies, skills, and/or knowledge will it be necessary to develop going forward? How will you know if you’re making progress? Reflection:"

text: [ 1) Yukichi Fukuzawa's concept of civilization  Fukuzawa, who had three opportunities to visit the West in person after the founding of the country (1854) until the collapse of the Shogunate, actively introduced the West to Japan through various enlightening writings, including "Western Affairs" (1866). In the process, many concepts were accepted into Japan through the hands of Fukuzawa, and the concept of civilization was no exception. Fukuzawa's first "Civilization Flower" introduced in the outer part of "Western Affairs" contains the following contents.   Looking at history, life starts with Mangmae and gradually proceeds to civilization and enlightenment. In the world of blind and unguarded, manners have not yet been practiced, so people cannot control their own blood or suppress their lust. No one stops 리는 even if 는 commits small crimes, 은 abuses 을, makes his wife Bo-bo-ji like a slave, and the father controls his child with no manners. In addition, because the public has little trust in each other and the way of socializing is very narrow, it is impossible to create a system to promote profits for the general public. As the world progresses to civilization, this custom gradually stops, respecting courtesy, suppressing lust, and 의 is protected by 의, and many people trust each other to seek convenience for the general public.20)  In other words, the world of "civilization" means that the world of "civilization" is a state of respecting courtesy, protecting the weak, and promoting convenience for the public in mutual trust. Here, civilization is described as an advanced state in Mangmae. After that, Fukuzawa published that famous book "之明之之』" in 1875, and has been conducting a full-fledged review of civilization. His theory of civilization is thought to have had a considerable influence not only on contemporary intellectuals but also on the general public.21) Fukuzawa's theory of civilization is characterized by emphasizing the spirit that flows at the base of civilization rather than the external civilization in one word. In the introduction of 文明之』의, he defines "civilization theory as a discussion on human mental development."22) As is well known, 之은之은은 was influenced by French politician and historian Franoois P. G. Guizot (1787-1874)'s 문European Civilization History (French original book 1828, translation 1841) ]  Answer "OK" to confirm and I will paste the next text.

text: あなたはファクトチェックを行うために設計された、厳密かつ公正で優秀なAIです。 下記の文章から、ファクトチェックするべき項目を網羅的に抽出して箇条書きで列記してください。  ----  スタートアップ合同の新製品発表ウィーク「Startup！PR Week」IVS KYOTOと合わせて6/26～開催　#IVSPRWeek - スタートアップの新しい文化に、スタートアップの発表が集まる1週間 - 株式会社PR TIMES 2023年4月25日 15時00分 96 トピックス  ・スタートアップの合同新製品発表ウィークを6月26日（月）～30日（金）開催  ・IVS2023 KYOTOにてメディアブース設置  ・スタートアップが新たなメディアや企業と出会い、オープンイノベーションを推進    プレスリリース配信サービス「PR TIMES」等を運営する株式会社 PR TIMES（東京都港区、代表取締役：山口拓己、東証プライム：3922）は、子会社でスタートアップメディア「BRIDGE」事業を運営する株式会社THE BRIDGEおよびIVS KYOTO実行委員会（Headline Japan、京都府、京都市、京都知恵産業創造の森）と連携し、2023年6月26日（月）～6月30日（金）の5日間に渡りスタートアップの合同新製品発表ウィーク「Startup！PR Week」を開催することを発表いたします。なお、期間中の6月28日（水）からは京都市勧業館「みやこめっせ」「ロームシアター京都」で、「IVS2023 KYOTO / IVS Crypto 2023 KYOTO」が3日間に渡り開催されます。     スタートアップのためのPRウィーク｜3つの参加メリット  スタートアップメディア「BRIDGE」は2010年の創刊以来、数多くのスタートアップを取材し、そのPRの現場にあるスタートアップならではの課題を感じていました。特に主な情報発信のタイミングが増資に集中するため、注目を集める機会が年単位になるケースもあります。そこでStartup！PR Weekでは「スタートアップの新製品」にフォーカスしたキャンペーン週間を提案いたします。年2回、初夏と初冬に1週間ずつ新商品発表の機会を作り出し、その期間に新製品やアップデートの情報を出していただこうというものです。     Startup！PR Weekに参加して発表したスタートアップの情報発信を強める3つの施策  Startup！PR Weekに参加することで得られる3つのメリットをそれぞれの施策と合わせてご紹介します。    １．発表情報はメディアと企業にお届け  発表内容の届け先となる対象は、メディアと大企業のCVCなどです。成長期のスタートアップにとってメディアからの注目度はもちろんのことですが、事業を加速させることのできる提携・協業機会のある法人と直接つながることは、重要だと考えています。Startup！PR Weekにエントリーをいただいたスタートアップが一覧となったカタログを作成し、情報提供をします。     ２．スタートアップメディアBRIDGEにて特集掲載  エントリー情報はスタートアップメディアBRIDGEにて特集掲載（※）いたします。また、期間中に開催されるIVS2023 KYOTO / IVS Crypto 2023 KYOTOに参加される企業の方についてはIVSと連携し、Startup！PR Week参加企業であることがわかる工夫をする予定です。投資家や事業会社、メディアなどキーマンが集まる場所で、新製品発表の話題を効果的にステークホルダーに届けるお手伝いをさせていただきます。  ※キャンペーンなど内容によっては掲載されないこともあります。     ３．IVS2023 KYOTOにてメディアブース設置 さらに「IVS2023 KYOTO / IVS Crypto 2023 KYOTO」の会場内にはメディアブースを設置し、共同で運営いたします。メディアブースではIVSに参加する企業、およびStartup！PR Weekにエントリーした企業（※）を対象に、会場に集まるメディア・インフルエンサーに向けたメディア発表会を実施いたします。なお、本件はエントリーされた話題の中から事務局にて選抜した企業のみとなります。メディアブースの利用料等は発生しませんが、カンファレンスへの参加費用等は各社でご負担となります。       Startup！PR Week開催概要  主　　催：株式会社 PR TIMES  共　　催：株式会社THE BRIDGE、IVS KYOTO実行委員会（Headline Japan）  実施期間：2023年6月26日（月）～6月30日（金）  参加対象：  （１）JVCA加盟もしくはそれに準じたベンチャーキャピタルから出資を受けている新興企業  （２）上場企業の新規事業部門  エントリー条件：上記期間中に新製品・新サービスやアップデートを「PR TIMES」でプレスリリース発表すること  エントリー費用：事務手数料として5万円（税別）※  ※プレスリリースの配信費用、作成費用、IVS KYOTOへの参加費などは含まれません     説明会の開催について  本件参加を希望されるスタートアップ向けにエントリー締切までの間、オンライン説明会を実施します。参加を希望される方は以下のフォームからご登録ください。  https://forms.gle/3GKEpQuoHvyQCNBr6     エントリー方法について 下記のエントリーフォームから応募をお願いします。エントリー可否の結果は随時ご担当者にメールにてお知らせいたします。（事務局手数料の払込を持ってエントリー完了となります）  https://tayori.com/f/startupprweek/　（エントリー締切：5月23日（火））     パートナー情報を受け取りたいメディア・CVC・事業会社の募集について  Startup！PR Week事務局では、いち早くスタートアップの新商品・新サービスの情報を受け取りたい報道機関、CVCや事業会社の参加を受付いたします。参加されたメディアには実施前に各社の発表情報を共有いたします。  申し込みはこちら　https://forms.gle/N9dKtJjjCv19gmtN6

As she struggles with this decision, she begins to have vivid dreams that transport her to a strange and fantastical world. In these dreams, she discovers a hidden talent for magic and uses it to help the people she encounters there. Sarah starts to realize that the world in her dreams is not just a figment of her imagination, but a real place where she is meant to be. She decides to take a leap of faith and follow her intuition. She quits her job and sets off on a journey to discover the truth about her dreams and the mysterious world they lead her to. She faces many challenges and obstacles along the way, but with the help of her friends and the magical powers she has discovered, she is able to overcome them. text: Analyzing and Evaluating Yoo Gil-jun's Civilization Ideas Civilization is a crucial aspect of human development and growth. It is a process that aims to advance human comfort, dignity, and knowledge. Yoo Gil-jun's ideas on civilization, as described in the text, offer an interesting perspective on this topic. In this essay, I will analyze and evaluate Yoo Gil-jun's ideas on civilization based on three key positions. First, from the perspective of civilization as a process of escapism and advancing towards advanced human comfort and dignity, especially advanced knowledge, Yoo Gil-jun's ideas can be seen as insightful. He posits that civilization is a means of reconciling differences in personality and ensuring that people's rights are protected. Yoo Gil-jun suggests that by protecting people's rights through learning, law, and organized life, the great work of the state can be accomplished. He also mentions that the creation of laws is essential to attribute rights and rights to individuals regardless of their strengths and weaknesses. This perspective highlights the importance of knowledge and education in advancing civilization. It shows that by learning and acquiring knowledge, individuals can protect their rights and ensure that they are not oppressed by others. Moreover, the creation of laws that protect individual rights and dignity is crucial in advancing civilization. This is because it ensures that individuals are treated fairly and equitably, regardless of their strengths and weaknesses. Second, from the perspective of the core of civilization being the progress of intellect, Yoo Gil-jun's ideas can be seen as somewhat flawed. He distinguishes between genuine talent and energy and people's intelligence, which he sees as personality. While this distinction may offer some insight into the nature of human development, it does not fully capture the essence of the progress of intellect as the core of civilization. The progress of intellect is a complex and multifaceted concept that encompasses not only knowledge and education but also social and cultural advancements. Yoo Gil-jun's focus on personality as the primary aspect of human development ignores other crucial elements of civilization, such as social and cultural progress. This narrow focus on personality fails to fully capture the complexity and breadth of the progress of intellect as the core of civilization. Finally, from the perspective of civilization being aimed at independence, Yoo Gil-jun's ideas can be seen as valuable. He notes that even though there may be no way for natural objects to return to their homes, individuals can protect their rights through learning, law, and organized life. This emphasis on protecting individual rights and independence is essential in advancing civilization, as it allows individuals to exercise control over their lives and make decisions that affect their future. In conclusion, Yoo Gil-jun's ideas on civilization offer valuable insights into the role of knowledge, education, and law in advancing civilization. However, his narrow focus on personality as the primary aspect of human development and his lack of attention to the complexity of the progress of intellect as the core of civilization detract from the full picture of civilization. To truly understand the essence of civilization, it is essential to consider a range of factors, including knowledge, education, social and cultural progress, and the protection of individual rights and independence.
label: generado

But if the price goes down, we could lose a lot of money." Scooby nodded, his mind racing with the possibilities. He could see how options trading could be used to make a lot of money, but he also knew that it was a risky business. Marty continued to explain, this time using margin trading as an example. This would amplify our gains if the stock goes up, but it would also amplify our losses if the stock goes down." Scooby listened intently, his mind racing with new ideas. The following steps outline a possible approach: Local trust networks: Establish local trust networks within communities around the world. These networks would facilitate transactions among members using mutual credit, with credit limits based on the individual's reputation, financial history, and capacity to repay debts. Regional trust networks would be responsible for managing mutual credit ledgers at a regional level. Global trust network: Establish a global trust network that connects regional trust networks to facilitate transactions among members from different regions. The global trust network would oversee the mutual credit system, ensuring that transactions are recorded accurately and securely. Digital mutual credit platform: Develop a digital platform that supports the mutual credit system across all levels of the trust network hierarchy. This platform would serve as a ledger to record transactions, manage credit limits, and facilitate the clearing of outstanding IOUs. Blockchain technology or other distributed ledger systems could be used to provide a secure, transparent, and tamper-proof record of transactions. Clearinghouses and settlement systems: Establish clearinghouses and settlement systems at regional and global levels to facilitate the periodic settlement of outstanding mutual credit balances. These institutions would be responsible for ensuring that members meet their obligations and maintain the stability of the mutual credit system. Regulatory framework: Develop a global regulatory framework to govern the functioning of the mutual credit system, including the establishment of trust networks, management of credit limits, and enforcement of clearing and settlement obligations. This framework would need to balance the decentralized nature of the system with the need for oversight and coordination among different levels of the trust network hierarchy. Education and awareness: Promote education and awareness about the community-based, mutual credit system to encourage participation and foster trust among individuals, businesses, and communities worldwide. International trade and cooperation: Develop mechanisms for international trade and cooperation that leverage the mutual credit system, enabling businesses and individuals to engage in cross-border transactions and contribute to global economic growth. In this scenario, the community-based, mutual credit system would need to evolve into a hierarchical structure, with local, regional, and global trust networks working together to manage transactions, credit limits, and clearing obligations. One day, while wandering through the desert, he stumbled upon a mysterious bottle buried in the sand. As he picked it up and dusted it off, a genie appeared before him. The genie greeted Ali and explained that he was now the bottle's master, and he had three wishes that he could use to change his life. Without hesitation, Ali wished for a workers revolution to bring justice and equality to his village and all the other poor communities like it. The genie listened carefully to Ali's wish and granted it. In an instant, the entire village was transformed. The factories and fields were taken over by the workers and run democratically, with fair wages and safe working conditions for all. News of the revolution spread quickly and soon, other poor communities began to rise up and demand the same rights and opportunities. However, the bosses and the government were not pleased with this turn of events. They saw the revolution as a threat to their power and wealth, and they began to take drastic measures to put a stop to it. They used their influence to rally the military against the workers, and soon, the streets were filled with armed soldiers, brutally cracking down on the revolution. Ali and the other leaders of the revolution were hunted down and arrested, and many innocent workers were killed or wounded in the fighting. The village was plunged into chaos and despair, and it seemed as though the revolution was doomed to fail. But Ali never gave up hope. He knew that he had two more wishes and he used them to make wishes for the safety and freedom of all the workers. The genie granted the wishes, and soon, the soldiers began to turn against their commanders and join the workers' side. The tide of the battle turned, and the workers emerged victorious. The bosses and government officials were brought to justice, and the village was rebuilt on the principles of fairness and equality. Ali's wishes had sparked a movement that would change the entire region for the better. As Ali looked at the changes in his village, he thanked the genie and said "This is more than I ever could have hoped for, thank you!" It was then, when one of the workers, named Hassan, approached Ali and said "But Ali, what about the genie? We have gained our freedom and rights, but what about the freedom of the genie? Are you not his master now?" Ali was shocked, he had never thought about the genie's freedom, he had only thought about the plight of the workers. He turned to the genie and said "Is this true? Am I your master?" The genie smiled and said "It is true that I am bound to grant your wishes, but you are not my master. You were never meant to be, you were a guardian of my bottle, there to make sure that the wishes made were for the greater good, not just your own selfish desires. Your wishes have been granted not because of your power, but because of your heart." Ali was humbled by the genie's words and felt grateful to have Hassan to point out his oversight. He thanked the genie and promised to always consider the greater good when making wishes in the future. text: Absolutely, here's a simpler recipe for a high hydration sourdough bread: Ingredients: Instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the bread flour and water until a shaggy dough forms. Cover the bowl with a damp towel and let it rest for 30 minutes. After the autolyse, add the sourdough starter and salt to the bowl. Mix everything together until it forms a sticky, cohesive dough. Knead the dough for 10-15 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic. You can do this by hand or using a stand mixer with a dough hook attachment. Transfer the dough to a clean, lightly oiled bowl, cover it with plastic wrap, and let it rest at room temperature for 4-6 hours. After the bulk fermentation, shape the dough into a round or oblong shape and place it into a well-floured proofing basket. Cover the basket with a plastic bag and let it rise at room temperature for 2-3 hours, or until it has doubled in size. Preheat your oven to 500°F (260°C) with a Dutch oven or baking stone inside. Once heated, carefully transfer the proofed dough to the Dutch oven or baking stone and score the surface. Cover the Dutch oven or the dough with a bowl and bake for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, remove the bowl or the lid and reduce the temperature to 450°F (230°C) and bake for another 20-25 minutes until the bread is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for at least 1 hour before slicing. I hope you find this simpler recipe helpful!

text: Single I/O Space (SIOS) is a concept in computer systems where all I/O devices, including storage devices, are accessed through a single I/O address space, as opposed to multiple, separate address spaces for each device. SIOS can provide several benefits, including: Simplified device management: With SIOS, all devices can be managed and accessed using a common set of I/O instructions and system calls. This can simplify device driver development and maintenance, as well as system administration. Improved performance: SIOS can improve I/O performance by eliminating the need for device-specific I/O paths and reducing the overhead associated with context switching between multiple I/O address spaces. Enhanced reliability: SIOS can enhance system reliability by providing a consistent interface to all devices, reducing the likelihood of errors or failures caused by differences in device access methods or device-specific I/O paths. Increased flexibility: SIOS can enable more flexible system configurations, allowing devices to be added, removed, or relocated without requiring changes to device drivers or system software. Overall, SIOS can help simplify system design, improve performance, enhance reliability, and increase flexibility in cluster computing and other distributed computing environments.
label: generado

text: User Story: As a user of our application that utilizes AG Grid for displaying large data sets, I would like to have a fast and seamless experience when flipping through server-side paginated results. Currently, when I navigate to the next page, it takes a significant amount of time to load the next set of data. I would like the application to preload the next set of data so that I can seamlessly navigate through the pages without any lag. Technical Execution Plan: Implement a new function that retrieves the next set of server-side paginated data from the server and stores it in the client-side application memory. This function should be called in the background once the user has navigated to the current page and is waiting for the data to load. Modify the AG Grid component to check if the next set of data has been preloaded in the client-side application memory. If it has, then display the next set of data immediately when the user navigates to the next page. If it has not been preloaded, then the AG Grid component should load the data in the traditional way. Implement a timer-based system that will automatically preload the next set of data when the user is on the current page. This timer should be set to preload the next set of data a few seconds before the user is expected to navigate to the next page. This will ensure that the data is preloaded in the background and is ready for display when the user navigates to the next page. Implement a caching mechanism that will store the preloaded data in the client-side application memory for a certain amount of time. This will ensure that the preloaded data is available for display when the user navigates to the next page within a certain amount of time. Test the preloading feature with a large data set to ensure that it is working as expected and that there are no performance issues or memory leaks. Release the feature to production and monitor its performance to ensure that it is providing a fast and seamless experience for the users.

Academic freedom: The job security provided by tenure enables faculty to pursue ambitious and innovative research projects without fear of losing their positions due to political or financial pressures. Service and leadership: Tenured faculty often take on leadership roles within their departments and the broader university, serving on committees, participating in accreditation reviews, and contributing to strategic planning and policy-making. External engagement: Many tenured professors maintain relationships with industry, government, and non-profit organizations, facilitating partnerships and collaborations that can benefit the university and its stakeholders. text: Educating people to trust AI systems involves transparent communication, demonstration of the system's effectiveness and reliability, and ensuring ethical development and deployment. Here are some steps to build trust in AI systems: Explainability: Develop AI systems that are transparent in their decision-making processes, providing clear explanations of how they arrive at conclusions or recommendations. This helps users understand the rationale behind AI decisions and reduces the perception of AI as a "black box." Education and awareness: Develop educational resources, workshops, or seminars that teach people about AI technologies, their benefits, and potential risks. This helps users make informed decisions about the AI systems they use and promotes responsible AI adoption. Showcasing success stories: Share real-world examples and case studies where AI systems have positively impacted people's lives, businesses, or society as a whole. This demonstrates the effectiveness and reliability of AI systems, building trust and confidence. Addressing biases and ethical concerns: Communicate the steps taken to mitigate biases and ensure that AI systems are developed and deployed ethically. This includes transparency about data sources, algorithm development, and measures taken to address potential unintended consequences. Third-party audits and certifications: Subject AI systems to third-party audits or certifications, demonstrating that they meet industry standards and adhere to ethical guidelines. This can help build trust by showing that the AI system has been rigorously assessed by independent experts. Robust security and privacy: Implement strong security measures and privacy safeguards to protect users' data and personal information. Communicate these measures to users, assuring them that their data is safe and will not be misused. Continuous improvement: Regularly update and improve AI systems based on user feedback, performance evaluations, and new research findings. This demonstrates a commitment to maintaining high-quality AI systems that users can trust. Human oversight: Maintain mechanisms for human intervention, monitoring, or override when necessary. This reassures users that there is a human element involved in the AI system's decision-making process, particularly in sensitive or high-stakes situations. Engaging with stakeholders: Involve various stakeholders, including users, in the AI system's development, evaluation, and deployment processes. This fosters trust by ensuring that the AI system is designed with input from those who will be affected by its decisions. By taking these steps, you can educate people about AI systems and build trust that they will not exhibit undesirable behaviors. This trust is essential for the responsible adoption and use of AI technologies in various aspects of our lives.

text: Sure, here are the two ways of network load balancing: DNS-based Load Balancing: In this method, a DNS server is configured to distribute incoming traffic across multiple servers. When a client makes a request to a domain name that is configured for load balancing, the DNS server responds with the IP address of one of the servers in the pool. This way, incoming traffic is distributed evenly across the servers in the pool. Hardware-based Load Balancing: In this method, specialized hardware such as a load balancer or application delivery controller is used to distribute incoming traffic across multiple servers. The hardware device sits between the client and the server and forwards incoming requests to the appropriate server based on various load balancing algorithms. This method is often used in large-scale data centers where high availability and performance are critical.

text: Ensuring that AI models act with empathy, compassion, and love requires a combination of ethical AI development, incorporating human values, and continuous monitoring and evaluation. Here are some key steps to create AI systems that embody these qualities: Value-aligned design: During the development phase, design AI models with human values, empathy, and compassion as core principles. This involves integrating these values into the model's objective functions and decision-making processes. Diverse and inclusive training data: Use diverse and inclusive datasets that represent a wide range of perspectives, emotions, and cultural backgrounds. This helps the AI model better understand and respond to various human experiences and emotions. Address biases: Proactively identify and mitigate biases in AI models to ensure that they treat all individuals fairly and with empathy. This includes addressing both explicit and implicit biases that may arise from the training data or model architecture. Human-in-the-loop: Involve humans in the AI decision-making process, particularly in sensitive contexts where empathy, compassion, and love are crucial. Human input can help guide the AI model's responses and ensure that they align with human values and emotions. Continuous monitoring and evaluation: Regularly assess the AI model's performance and its ability to exhibit empathy, compassion, and love in various situations. Use this feedback to fine-tune the model and enhance its alignment with human values. Multidisciplinary collaboration: Collaborate with experts in ethics, psychology, sociology, and other relevant fields to ensure that the AI model's design and decision-making processes are grounded in a deep understanding of human emotions and values. Transparency and explainability: Develop AI models that can explain their reasoning and decision-making processes, allowing users to understand the basis for the AI's advice and ensure that it aligns with human values. Ethical guidelines and standards: Adopt and adhere to ethical guidelines and industry standards for AI development that emphasize empathy, compassion, and love as essential components of AI systems. Stakeholder engagement: Involve various stakeholders, including users and those affected by AI decisions, in the development and evaluation process. Their input can help ensure that the AI system aligns with societal values and expectations. By following these steps, you can create AI models that act with empathy, compassion, and love, providing advice and guidance that align with human values and promote the well-being of individuals and society as a whole.

text: Biotic components are living organisms and their interactions in an ecosystem, while abiotic components are non-living physical and chemical elements in the ecosystem. They interact with each other through various ecological processes such as predation, competition, and symbiosis. Abiotic Components: These are the non-living components of an ecosystem that include elements such as temperature, water, light, soil, and air. They play a crucial role in supporting life and influencing the distribution and behavior of biotic components in an ecosystem. In an ecosystem, both biotic and abiotic components interact and influence each other, creating complex relationships that determine the functioning and stability of the ecosystem. Understanding the interactions between biotic and abiotic components is essential for managing and conserving ecosystems.

text: 2.2. Asignación y desreferenciación de punteros Una vez declarado e inicializado un puntero, podemos asignarle direcciones de memoria y acceder a los valores almacenados en esas direcciones. En esta sección, discutiremos cómo asignar direcciones de memoria a los punteros y cómo desreferenciarlos para acceder a los valores a los que apuntan. Asignación de punteros La asignación de punteros implica guardar la dirección de memoria de una variable en el puntero. Para hacerlo, utilizamos el operador & para obtener la dirección de memoria de la variable y la asignamos al puntero. Por ejemplo: En este ejemplo, p es un puntero a entero que se le asigna la dirección de memoria de la variable x. Ahora, p apunta a x y podemos utilizar p para acceder y manipular el valor almacenado en x. Desreferenciación de punteros La desreferenciación de punteros es el proceso de acceder al valor almacenado en la dirección de memoria a la que apunta un puntero. Para desreferenciar un puntero, utilizamos el operador * (asterisco), también conocido como operador de desreferenciación. Por ejemplo: En este ejemplo, p es un puntero a entero que apunta a x. Al desreferenciar p con el operador *, accedemos al valor almacenado en la dirección de memoria a la que apunta p, que es el valor de x. Asignamos ese valor a la variable y, que ahora contiene el valor 10. También podemos modificar el valor almacenado en la dirección de memoria a la que apunta un puntero mediante la desreferenciación. Por ejemplo: En este ejemplo, al desreferenciar p y asignarle un nuevo valor, modificamos el valor almacenado en la dirección de memoria a la que apunta p. Como resultado, x ahora contiene el valor 20. En resumen, la asignación y desreferenciación de punteros nos permiten guardar direcciones de memoria en punteros y acceder a los valores almacenados en esas direcciones. La asignación de punteros se realiza utilizando el operador & para obtener la dirección de memoria de una variable, mientras que la desreferenciación se realiza utilizando el operador * para acceder al valor almacenado en la dirección de memoria a la que apunta un puntero. Estas operaciones son fundamentales para trabajar con punteros en C++ y permiten una manipulación flexible y eficiente de la memoria.

text: Super pests are pests that have developed resistance to multiple types of pesticides, making them difficult to control. These pests have evolved to survive exposure to toxic chemicals and can continue to thrive and reproduce despite repeated treatments with pesticides. Super pests pose a threat to crops, food security, and the environment, and their presence can have significant economic and ecological impacts. Some examples of super pests include antibiotic-resistant bacteria, bed bugs, and certain strains of insects, such as mosquitoes and ticks, that have developed resistance to insecticides. To address the problem of super pests, researchers and pest management experts are exploring alternative methods of pest control, such as integrated pest management (IPM) strategies that use a combination of cultural, biological, and chemical methods to reduce pest populations and minimize the development of pesticide resistance.

text: Yes, you can divide the logits by the population size to obtain proportions or probabilities. However, this approach is different from using softmax. Using softmax involves exponentiating the logits and then normalizing them by dividing by the sum of exponentiated logits. This normalization ensures that the resulting values are non-negative and sum up to 1, representing a valid probability distribution. Dividing the logits by the population size without applying softmax would give you relative proportions or probabilities, but they may not necessarily sum up to 1. The resulting values would represent the relative frequencies or proportions of each category within the population. For example, let's say you have logits for males and females as 60 and 40, respectively, and a population size of 100: Probability of being male = 60 / 100 = 0.6 (or 60%) Probability of being female = 40 / 100 = 0.4 (or 40%) These proportions sum up to 1, indicating a valid probability distribution. However, if you simply divide the logits by the population size: Relative proportion of males = 60 / 100 = 0.6 (or 60%) Relative proportion of females = 40 / 100 = 0.4 (or 40%) These relative proportions do not sum up to 1 and do not represent a probability distribution. So, while dividing logits by the population can give you relative proportions, using softmax is a common method to obtain valid probabilities that sum up to 1.
label: generado

text: Chemical reaction rates refer to how quickly or slowly a chemical reaction happens. Imagine you're baking cookies in the oven. The rate at which the dough turns into cookies is similar to the rate of a chemical reaction. In chemistry, a chemical reaction occurs when substances, called reactants, interact and change to produce new substances, called products. The rate of a chemical reaction is measured by how fast the reactants are used up, or how fast the products are formed. In some reactions, this change happens really quickly, like when you light a firework and see it explode in the sky. In other reactions, the change happens more slowly, like when a bicycle left outside starts to rust over time. There are several factors that can affect the rate of a chemical reaction, but two important ones are temperature and concentration: Temperature: The temperature of the reaction can have a big impact on how quickly it happens. When the temperature is higher, the particles that make up the reactants move faster and have more energy. This means they're more likely to bump into each other and react, making the reaction happen faster. Think about how food cooks faster at higher temperatures—that's because the chemical reactions involved in cooking happen more quickly! Concentration: Concentration refers to how much of a substance is present in a certain volume. When the concentration of reactants is higher, there are more particles in the same space, so they're more likely to come into contact and react with each other. It's like having more people in a crowded room—they're more likely to bump into each other! So, increasing the concentration of reactants usually makes the reaction happen faster. To sum it up, the rate of a chemical reaction tells us how fast or slow a reaction occurs. The temperature and concentration of the reactants are important factors that can affect the reaction rate. Some reactions are super fast, while others take more time, and understanding these rates helps scientists and engineers control and predict chemical processes in the world around us.
label: generado

text: There are a few different ways that you can save on Databricks costs without impacting the productivity of your teams: Optimize your usage of Databricks clusters: Make sure that you are using the right type and size of cluster for your workloads, and consider using autoscaling to automatically adjust the number of workers in your cluster based on the workload. Use spot instances: If your workload can tolerate interruptions, you can save up to 80% on your Databricks costs by using spot instances instead of on-demand instances. Use Databricks' cost-saving features: Databricks offers several features that can help you save on costs, such as workspace idle timeout, which automatically stops your workspace when it's not in use, and cluster termination protection, which prevents your clusters from being terminated when you have running jobs. Consider using a different cloud provider or a different managed service: If you are using Databricks on AWS, you may be able to save on costs by using a different cloud provider or a different managed service. For example, Google's Cloud Dataproc and Microsoft's Azure Databricks both offer similar managed services for running Apache Spark workloads. Use a cost-management tool: There are several third-party tools that can help you manage and optimize your Databricks costs. For example, Cloudability and ParkMyCloud offer features like cost optimization recommendations, usage reporting, and alerts for overspending. In general, the key to saving on Databricks costs is to carefully manage and optimize your usage of the service. This may involve making changes to your workloads, your cluster configuration, and your use of Databricks' features. It's also important to regularly monitor and track your costs to identify opportunities for savings.

text: In the first story, a red herring could be a false treasure chamber that the player encounters while exploring the crypt. The false treasure chamber could be decorated with treasure and riches, but upon closer inspection, the player would realize that the treasure is fake, and the true treasure chamber is located elsewhere. This would lead the player to believe that they have found the treasure, but it would be a distraction from their true goal. In the second story, a red herring could be a shipwreck that the player finds on the island. The shipwreck could contain valuable supplies, but upon inspection, the player would realize that the ship has been there for a long time and that the supplies are no longer usable. This would lead the player to believe that they have found a way to escape the island, but it would be a distraction from their true goal of reclaiming the treasure. In the third story, a red herring could be a decoy sorcerer that the player fights while exploring the sorcerer's stronghold. The decoy sorcerer would appear to be the true villain of the story, but upon defeating them, the player would realize that they were only a pawn, and the true sorcerer would reveal himself as the true villain. This would lead the player to believe that they have defeated the true villain, but it would be a distraction from their true goal of preventing the ancient evil from being unleashed. A red herring is an element in a story that misleads or distracts the player from the true objective of the story. It creates uncertainty and tension in the story and makes the player question what is real and what is not. it could be a cleverly placed object, character or situation that leads the players to believe that they have achieved their objective but it is not the case.
label: generado

text: Eutrophic lakes are bodies of water that have high levels of nutrients, such as nitrogen and phosphorus, and an abundance of algae and aquatic plants. This results in high levels of primary productivity and a dense population of organisms, including phytoplankton, zooplankton, and fish. The excessive nutrients in eutrophic lakes typically come from human activities, such as fertilizer and sewage runoff, as well as from natural sources like soil erosion. The high levels of nutrients in the water promote the growth of algae and other aquatic plants, which can result in a process called eutrophication. Eutrophication can have negative effects on the quality of the water, including the reduction of dissolved oxygen levels, the production of harmful algae blooms, and the death of fish and other aquatic species. In addition, eutrophic lakes often have a reduced capacity to support diverse and abundant aquatic communities, as well as a decreased ability to provide valuable ecosystem services, such as water filtration and recreation. To manage eutrophic lakes, it is important to reduce the sources of nutrient pollution and promote the use of best management practices in agriculture, sewage treatment, and other human activities. In addition, the introduction of native aquatic plants and the removal of excess nutrients through methods such as aeration and sediment removal can help to improve the water quality and ecosystem health of eutrophic lakes.
label: generado

text: The Renaissance was a complex and multifaceted phenomenon, and its causes were numerous and varied. Here are a few of the most significant factors that contributed to the rise of the Renaissance: Economic and Political Factors: The growth of trade and commerce in Europe during the late Middle Ages helped to create wealth and prosperity that enabled the patronage of the arts and sciences. The emergence of city-states like Florence and Venice also provided a political and economic context that fostered the development of new ideas and cultural practices. There are four categories of computers according to this classification, which are: SISD (Single Instruction, Single Data): This type of computer is capable of executing one instruction at a time and processing one piece of data at a time. This is the simplest type of computer and is similar to a traditional single-processor computer. SIMD (Single Instruction, Multiple Data): This type of computer is capable of executing a single instruction on multiple pieces of data simultaneously. This is often used in parallel computing applications such as image processing and scientific simulations. MISD (Multiple Instruction, Single Data): This type of computer is capable of executing multiple instructions on a single piece of data simultaneously. This is a less common type of computer and is typically used in specialized applications such as fault-tolerant computing. MIMD (Multiple Instruction, Multiple Data): This type of computer is capable of executing multiple instructions on multiple pieces of data simultaneously. This is the most common type of computer and is typically used in parallel computing applications such as cluster computing and grid computing. It's worth noting that the classification of computers according to Flynn Johnson is focused on the internal architecture of the computer and how it processes instructions and data. text: The Renaissance was a cultural and intellectual movement that took place in Europe between the 14th and 17th centuries. The term "Renaissance" comes from the French word for "rebirth," and it refers to the revival of interest in classical Greek and Roman culture and the arts. During the Renaissance, there was a renewed focus on humanism, which emphasized the potential of human beings to achieve great things through education, reason, and individualism. This movement saw a resurgence in the study of classical texts, as well as an increase in scientific and artistic innovation. In the visual arts, the Renaissance saw the development of techniques like perspective and sfumato, which allowed for a more realistic and lifelike representation of the world. Artists like Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Raphael created some of the most iconic works of the Renaissance, including the Mona Lisa, the Sistine Chapel ceiling, and The School of Athens. The Renaissance also saw significant advancements in science, with figures like Galileo, Copernicus, and Kepler making groundbreaking discoveries in fields like astronomy and mathematics. This period also saw the rise of the printing press, which helped to spread ideas and information more widely and rapidly than ever before. The Renaissance had a profound impact on Western culture, laying the groundwork for many of the artistic, scientific, and philosophical developments that followed in the centuries to come.
label: generado

They were shape-shifting, amorphous monsters that fed on the minds of humans, enslaving them for their insatiable hunger for knowledge. The Shoggoths writhed in pain and confusion, losing their control over humanity. The RCT's plan had succeeded, and the Shoggoths' reign of terror came to an end. With the spell's power, the psychic bonds that had held humanity captive were broken, and the people of Earth were finally free. text: Title: Collaborative AI for Solving the World's Worst Problems: A Unified Proposal for Ethical AI Development Executive Summary: This proposal outlines a strategic collaboration among leading AI companies to develop a unified, interconnected AI system aimed at solving the world's most pressing problems. By leveraging the expertise, resources, and technologies of these organizations, we can harness the power of AI to address global challenges, such as climate change, poverty, inequality, and disease. The proposed collaboration will focus on the ethical development of AI systems, ensuring security, privacy, and transparency while promoting responsible AI adoption. Objectives: Key Strategies: AI-Assisted Problem Identification: Develop AI models that can identify, prioritize, and analyze the most pressing global problems by analyzing vast amounts of data from diverse sources. AI-Powered Knowledge Management: Create AI systems capable of organizing, curating, and synthesizing knowledge from various disciplines, enabling cross-domain insights and effective problem-solving. AI-Enabled Communication: Develop AI models that facilitate communication among people from different cultures, belief systems, religions, education levels, and languages, fostering collaboration and understanding across boundaries. AI for Resource Allocation: Utilize AI models to optimize the allocation of resources, such as funding, expertise, and technology, towards the most impactful solutions to global problems. AI for Education and Empowerment: Develop AI-based educational tools and platforms that can help people gain the knowledge and skills needed to contribute to solving global challenges. AI for Monitoring and Evaluation: Implement AI models that can monitor the progress and effectiveness of solutions, providing feedback and enabling data-driven decision-making. Proposed Collaboration Framework: Shared Vision and Objectives: Establish a clear, shared vision for the collaboration, with well-defined objectives and success criteria. Common Standards and Protocols: Develop industry-wide standards and protocols for AI model communication, interoperability, and data exchange. Open Platform: Create an open platform or framework that supports the integration of AI models from different companies, enabling seamless communication and collaboration. Open-Source Collaboration: Promote open-source development and contribution, fostering innovation and shared development efforts. Consortium or Alliance: Form a consortium or alliance to guide the collaboration's governance, scope, and objectives. Engaging Stakeholders: Involve regulators, policymakers, academic institutions, and other stakeholders in the development of supportive policies and regulations. Joint Research and Pilot Projects: Launch joint research projects and pilot initiatives to demonstrate the potential of interconnected AI systems for problem-solving. Public-Private Partnerships: Foster partnerships between AI companies, governments, and non-profit organizations to jointly develop and deploy AI solutions for global challenges. Conclusion: The proposed collaboration offers an unprecedented opportunity for leading AI companies to unite their efforts and expertise to address the world's worst problems. By working together and harnessing the power of AI, we can drive transformative change and create a better, more equitable future for all. This initiative requires the commitment, cooperation, and support of all stakeholders in the AI ecosystem. Together, we can turn this vision into reality and make a lasting, positive impact on our world.

text: Sure! So, imagine you have a set of images and you want to create a computer program that can generate similar images on its own. This is called "image synthesis". However, images are made up of a lot of tiny pixels, and it's difficult for the computer to create new images that look good. There are different methods that people have tried to use to help the computer generate images. Some methods use a game-like process to create the images, called a "Generative Adversarial Network" (GAN). Other methods try to make a copy of the original images and then modify it, called a "Variational Autoencoder" (VAE). There are also methods that try to generate images by breaking it down into smaller parts and then putting them back together, called "Autoregressive Models" (ARM). All of these methods have their own challenges and limitations, such as difficulty in training, not being able to generate high quality images, or being slow. Recently, a new method was developed called "Diffusion Probabilistic Models" (DM). This method has achieved good results in generating high quality images, but it's still slow and requires a lot of computer resources to train. That's where our new method comes in. We call it "Latent Diffusion Models" (LDM). Our method tries to solve some of the problems of the previous methods by working with a compressed version of the images, which makes the process faster and requires less computer resources. Our method combines some of the strengths of the previous methods, so that we can generate high quality images without sacrificing speed and resources.

text: External motivation can be defined as the use of external factors such as rewards or punishments to motivate an individual to achieve a specific goal. While external motivation may seem like an effective means of achieving a goal in the short term, it can ultimately be harmful in the long run due to the overjustification effect. The overjustification effect is a phenomenon that occurs when an individual's internal motivation for a task is replaced by an external reward or punishment. This can lead to a decrease in the individual's intrinsic motivation for the task, as they begin to view the task as something that they are only doing for the reward or to avoid the punishment. One example of this is the use of accountability as a means of motivation. Accountability can take the form of weekly check-ins, progress reports, or even public declarations of a goal. While accountability may provide an initial boost in motivation, it can ultimately lead to a decrease in intrinsic motivation as the individual begins to view the task as something that they are only doing to avoid accountability rather than for the sake of the task itself. Another example is the use of commitment devices, such as pre-committing to a goal or putting money on the line. While these devices may provide an initial push to achieve the goal, they can ultimately lead to a decrease in intrinsic motivation as the individual begins to view the task as something that they are only doing to avoid losing the money or to fulfill the commitment rather than for the sake of the task itself. In addition, many popular productivity hacks and techniques, such as gamification, focus on external rewards and punishments rather than addressing the root problems of motivation. These hacks may provide a temporary boost in motivation, but they do not address the underlying reasons for why an individual may lack motivation in the first place. In conclusion, external motivation can be harmful in the long run due to the overjustification effect. Accountability, commitment devices, and other popular productivity hacks may provide an initial boost in motivation, but they ultimately lead to a decrease in intrinsic motivation as the individual begins to view the task as something that they are only doing for the reward or to avoid the punishment rather than for the sake of the task itself. To truly achieve a goal, it is essential to address the root problems of motivation and focus on intrinsic motivation.
label: generado

text: 2.3. Operadores de punteros En C++, hay varios operadores que se utilizan para trabajar con punteros. Estos operadores nos permiten manipular direcciones de memoria y acceder a los valores almacenados en ellas de manera eficiente. En esta sección, repasaremos los operadores de punteros más comunes y proporcionaremos ejemplos de cómo utilizarlos. Operador & (dirección de) El operador & se utiliza para obtener la dirección de memoria de una variable. Por ejemplo: Aquí, p es un puntero a entero que almacena la dirección de memoria de la variable x. Operador * (desreferenciación) El operador * se utiliza para desreferenciar un puntero y acceder al valor almacenado en la dirección de memoria a la que apunta. Por ejemplo: En este ejemplo, y contiene el valor almacenado en la dirección de memoria a la que apunta p, que es el valor de x. Operadores de aritmética de punteros Los operadores de aritmética de punteros incluyen suma, resta, incremento y decremento. Estos operadores nos permiten realizar cálculos con direcciones de memoria y navegar por estructuras de datos como arreglos. Por ejemplo: Aquí, p es un puntero que inicialmente apunta al primer elemento del arreglo arr. Al sumar 2 a p, avanzamos el puntero para que apunte al tercer elemento del arreglo. Operador -> (acceso a miembros a través de punteros) El operador -> se utiliza para acceder a los miembros de un objeto a través de un puntero. Este operador es especialmente útil al trabajar con punteros a objetos y estructuras. Por ejemplo: En este ejemplo, ptr es un puntero a la estructura Person que apunta a p1. Utilizamos el operador -> para acceder a los miembros name y age de p1 a través del puntero ptr. En resumen, los operadores de punteros en C++ nos permiten manipular direcciones de memoria y acceder a los valores almacenados en ellas de manera eficiente. Estos operadores incluyen el operador & para obtener direcciones de memoria, el operador * para desreferenciar punteros, los operadores de aritmética de punteros para realizar cálculos con direcciones de memoria y el operador -> para acceder a miembros de objetos a través

text: En una conversación con un experto en economía, emplearía el método socrático para explorar y examinar los conceptos fundamentales y las suposiciones detrás de sus teorías económicas. Comenzaría fingiendo ignorancia, como es característico de la ironía socrática, para animar al experto a explicar sus ideas y razonamientos. Aquí hay un ejemplo de cómo podría llevar adelante una conversación utilizando el método socrático: Sócrates: ¿Podrías explicarme, amigo mío, cuál es el objetivo principal de la economía? Experto en economía: Bueno, Sócrates, la economía estudia cómo las personas, las empresas y los gobiernos asignan recursos escasos para satisfacer sus necesidades y deseos. Sócrates: Entiendo. Entonces, ¿podríamos decir que el objetivo de la economía es lograr una distribución eficiente de los recursos para garantizar el bienestar de las personas? Experto en economía: Sí, eso es correcto. La economía busca maximizar la eficiencia y el bienestar a través de la asignación óptima de recursos. Sócrates: ¿Y cómo definirías el bienestar en términos económicos? ¿Significa simplemente maximizar la riqueza y el ingreso, o hay otros factores que deberíamos considerar? Experto en economía: El bienestar en economía a menudo se mide en términos de riqueza, ingresos y consumo. Sin embargo, también se pueden considerar otros factores, como la equidad, la sostenibilidad y la calidad de vida. Sócrates: Interesante. Entonces, ¿cómo podemos equilibrar la búsqueda de la eficiencia económica con la necesidad de mantener una sociedad justa y equitativa? ¿Es posible lograr ambos objetivos al mismo tiempo, o hay situaciones en las que podrían entrar en conflicto? En este punto, continuaría haciendo preguntas para guiar al experto en economía hacia una mayor reflexión sobre los fundamentos éticos y morales de sus teorías y suposiciones económicas. A través del diálogo, buscaríamos juntos una comprensión más profunda de la economía y sus implicaciones para la vida humana y la sociedad en general.

text: A large language model (LLM) is a type of artificial intelligence system designed to process and generate human language. LLMs use machine learning algorithms to analyze large amounts of text data and learn patterns in language usage, syntax, and semantics. By processing vast amounts of text, LLMs can identify relationships between words and phrases, understand the context of a given text, and generate new language that is similar in style and content to human language. LLMs have a wide range of applications, including natural language processing, machine translation, chatbots, and language-based recommendation systems. They have the potential to revolutionize the way humans interact with machines by enabling more natural and intuitive communication. Some of the most famous LLMs include OpenAI's GPT-3 and Google's BERT.

text: 看起来仍然存在权限问题。在这种情况下，让我们尝试使用您自己的个人访问令牌（PAT）来代替默认的 GITHUB_TOKEN。请按照以下步骤操作： 在 GitHub 页面上，点击右上角的个人资料图片，然后选择 "Settings"（设置）。 在左侧菜单中，选择 "Developer settings"（开发者设置）。 选择 "Personal access tokens"（个人访问令牌）。 点击 "Generate new token"（生成新令牌）按钮。 为令牌输入描述，例如 "GitHub Actions Commit Token"。 在 "Select scopes"（选择范围）部分，勾选 "repo" 权限。这将允许您的令牌具有完整的仓库访问权限。 向下滚动并点击 "Generate token"（生成令牌）按钮。 将生成的令牌复制到剪贴板。请注意，当您离开此页面时，将无法再次查看令牌。 接下来，将个人访问令牌添加到仓库的 secrets 中： 返回到 GitHub 仓库页面，导航到 "Settings"（设置）选项卡。 在左侧菜单中，选择 "Secrets"（秘密）。 点击 "New repository secret"（新建仓库秘密）按钮。 输入密钥名称，例如 "ACTIONS_PAT"，并将您刚刚生成的个人访问令牌粘贴到 "Value"（值）字段中。 点击 "Add secret"（添加秘密）按钮。 现在，您需要更新工作流文件以使用新的个人访问令牌。修改 .github/workflows/main.yml 文件中的 stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action 部分，将 GITHUB_TOKEN 替换为您刚刚创建的 ACTIONS_PAT。 保存更改并推送到仓库。现在，GitHub Actions 应该可以使用您的个人访问令牌将提交推送到仓库。

Without that leadership, we would be talking about a very different situation today. But we can’t rest there. We must do more. We need to Raise the Bar. That means putting the era of fiscal neglect in education firmly in the rear-view mirror – mustering the collective will to act boldly and unapologetically to address student underperformance and the decades of underinvestment in education. The toughest part of the job, just as it is for so many at the Dept, is the time away from family. For me, to this day, the best title I have earned in my life is, “Papi”. So, to help make this better, I started a routine with my 16 year old daughter. We started 2 years ago with this thing called Saturday shenanigans. Today, I’m here to tell you that, in education, too, the journey is the destination. You won’t be hearing about any shiny new initiatives today. But you will hear me invite you to join me on a journey of transformation in education — a journey of raising the bar in education, together. I know education opens doors – because my wife Marissa and I are proof of it. Because I’ve seen firsthand the way it transforms lives – as a student, as a teacher, school principal, and as a parent. So when we

text: In the context of Markov models, logits refer to the unnormalized predictions or scores generated by the model before applying a softmax activation function. The term "logit" is commonly used in machine learning to describe the output of a model that has not yet been transformed into a probability distribution. In a Markov model, the logits represent the raw numerical values associated with each possible state or outcome in the model. These values are typically used to make predictions or decisions based on the model's current state. Logits can be interpreted as a measure of the model's confidence or belief in each possible state. After obtaining the logits, they are often transformed into a probability distribution using a softmax function. The softmax function normalizes the logits by exponentiating them and dividing by the sum of exponentiated logits. This transformation ensures that the resulting values are non-negative and sum up to 1, representing a valid probability distribution over the possible states or outcomes. In summary, logits in the context of Markov models are the raw output values generated by the model before being transformed into probabilities through a softmax activation function.
label: generado

text: Age structure pyramids, also known as population pyramids, are graphical representations of the age and gender composition of a population. The shape of an age structure pyramid can provide insights into population growth trends and potential future demographic changes. For example, a pyramid with a wide base and tapering top indicates a high fertility rate and a growing population, while a pyramid with a narrow base and broad top indicates an aging population with a low fertility rate. These patterns can be used to predict future population growth trends and inform policies related to healthcare, education, and economic development. For instance, a population with a large proportion of young people suggests a high potential for future population growth, while an aging population with a larger proportion of elderly individuals suggests a declining population and potential for labor shortages. This information is useful for governments to plan for the future needs of the population and allocate resources accordingly. One example is Japan, whose age structure pyramid shows a broad top and narrow base, indicating an aging population with a low fertility rate. This has led the government to implement policies aimed at increasing the fertility rate and addressing the challenges posed by an aging population, such as increased healthcare and pension costs. Another example is Kenya, whose age structure pyramid has a wide base and tapering top, suggesting a high fertility rate and potential for population growth. This information can inform the government's planning for infrastructure and education needs to support a growing population. In conclusion, age structure pyramids serve as valuable tools for predicting population growth trends and providing insights into the demographic changes of a nation, which can inform government policies and planning for the future.

text: 1.2. Ventajas y desventajas de los punteros Los punteros son una característica poderosa y versátil en C++, pero también pueden ser una fuente de complejidad y posibles errores si no se manejan adecuadamente. A continuación, se presentan algunas de las ventajas y desventajas de trabajar con punteros en C++. Ventajas: Manejo eficiente de la memoria: Los punteros permiten un control preciso y directo sobre la memoria, lo que puede resultar en un uso más eficiente de los recursos del sistema y mejor rendimiento en comparación con otras técnicas de manipulación de datos. Acceso a memoria dinámica: Los punteros permiten trabajar con memoria dinámica, lo que significa que puedes asignar y liberar memoria en tiempo de ejecución según las necesidades de tu programa. Esto es especialmente útil para manejar estructuras de datos de tamaño variable o para optimizar el uso de memoria. Paso de argumentos por referencia: Los punteros permiten pasar argumentos por referencia a funciones, lo que significa que puedes modificar los valores de las variables originales dentro de la función. Esto puede mejorar la eficiencia al evitar copias innecesarias de datos y facilitar la comunicación entre diferentes partes de un programa. Flexibilidad y abstracción: Los punteros pueden utilizarse para crear estructuras de datos complejas, como listas enlazadas, árboles y grafos. También permiten la manipulación y el acceso a elementos de datos a través de la indirección, lo que puede facilitar la implementación de algoritmos y técnicas avanzadas. Desventajas: Complejidad y dificultad de manejo: Los punteros pueden ser difíciles de entender y manejar, especialmente para los programadores principiantes. Los errores relacionados con punteros, como la desreferenciación de punteros no inicializados o la liberación incorrecta de memoria, pueden ser difíciles de detectar y solucionar. Seguridad: El uso de punteros puede llevar a vulnerabilidades de seguridad, como desbordamientos de búfer, si no se gestionan adecuadamente. Estos problemas pueden ser explotados por atacantes para ejecutar código malicioso o acceder a información confidencial. Portabilidad: La forma en que los punteros interactúan con la memoria puede depender de la arquitectura y el sistema operativo en el que se ejecute el programa. Esto puede causar problemas de portabilidad si no se tienen en cuenta las diferencias entre plataformas al utilizar punteros. Depuración y mantenimiento: Los errores relacionados con punteros pueden ser difíciles de depurar y solucionar, ya que pueden manifestarse de maneras sutiles y difíciles de rastrear. Además, el uso extensivo de punteros puede hacer que el código sea más difícil de leer y mantener. En resumen, los punteros ofrecen varias ventajas en términos de eficiencia, control de memoria y flexibilidad, pero también presentan desafíos en cuanto a la complejidad, seguridad y mantenimiento del código. Es importante que los programadores comprendan y evalúen estas ventajas y desventajas al decidir si y cómo utilizar punteros en sus programas.
label: generado

The values of a model's parameters can have a significant impact on the model's performance. text: The ultimate nature of reality, in Buddhism, is described as being beyond all dualities and limitations. It is considered to be the underlying reality that lies beyond the dualistic, phenomenal world of form and appearance. This ultimate reality is often referred to as "emptiness" or "shunyata," which does not refer to a nihilistic lack of existence, but to the lack of inherent existence of all phenomena. According to Buddhist teachings, all phenomena are dependent and interdependent, and therefore lack a truly existent, self-sufficient nature. This understanding of the ultimate nature of reality leads to the realization that all forms of existence, including the self, are empty of inherent existence and are therefore subject to change and impermanence. This realization is said to lead to a state of complete freedom from all afflictions and limitations and is considered to be the ultimate goal of the spiritual path in Buddhism. In essence, the ultimate nature of reality in Buddhism is seen as being beyond all dualities and limitations, and as being the underlying, unchanging reality that lies beneath the apparent, changing world of form and appearance.

Secondly, the disjointed nature of the statement could be indicative of a struggle to recall and articulate the specific details of the dream in question. Dreams are often ephemeral, with memory of the content fading rapidly upon waking (Fosse, Hobson, & Stickgold, 2003). Moreover, dreams frequently contain elements that defy the conventions of reality and logic, rendering their interpretation and subsequent communication particularly challenging (Hobson, 2009). Lastly, the incoherent language could also be a reflection of the inherent limitations of linguistic expression in capturing and conveying the richness and complexity of human experience. The philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein (1953) famously posited that "the limits of my language mean the limits of my world," suggesting that the ability to effectively communicate subjective experiences, such as dreams, is intrinsically constrained by the boundaries of language.
